title: SQLNOT Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLNOT Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
NOT
The
NOT
command is used with WHERE to only 
include rows where a condition is not true.
The following SQL statement selects all fields from "Customers" where country is NOT "Germany":
Example
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE 
  NOT Country='Germany';

Reference

❯
★
+1

quiz.question:
What is NOT
The
NOT
command is used with WHERE to only 
include rows where a condition?
options:
NOT "Germany":
Example
SELECT * FROM Customers

  NOT Country='Germany';

quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of NOT
The
NOT
command is used with WHERE to only 
include rows where a condition is 'not true'.

quiz.question: What is where country?
options:
NOT "Germany":
Example
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE 
  NOT Country='Germany';

Reference

❯
★
+1
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of where country is 'NOT "Germany":
Example
SELECT * FROM Customers
WHERE 
  NOT Country='Germany';

Reference

❯
★
+1'.

summary: This tutorial covers SQLNOT Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLNOT Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLNOT Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
